translation: Those who want to enter the first liberation or even the liberation from ideation, sensation, cessation, and liberation are able to enter as they wish. Those who want to enter the first sphere of mastery up to the eighth sphere of mastery are able to enter as they wish.

source_sentence: 欲入初靜慮定乃至想受滅定即隨意能入，欲入初遍處乃至第十遍處即隨意能入，
translation: The one who wishes to enter the concentration of the first trance up to the samdhi of conceptual identification, feeling and cessation is able to enter at will. The one who wishes to enter the pervasive sense-field or even the tenth pervasive-field can enter at will.

source_sentence: 欲入三解脫門即隨意能入，欲引發五神通即隨意能引發。

translation: All the nonregressing bodhisattva mahāsattvas who have accomplished the contemplation of unsurpassed enlightenment always aren’t far from the great aspiration for enlightenment, and they don’t value form.

translation: They don’t value sensation, perception, volition, or consciousness; they don’t value the sense-field of the eye or even the sense-field of the mind; they don’t value the sense-field of form or even the sense-field of dharmas.

source_sentence: 不貴重眼界乃至意界，不貴重色界乃至法界，不貴重眼識界乃至意識界，
translation: It doesn't value the element of eye and even the element of mind, the element of form and even the element of dharmas, or the element of visual consciousness and even the element of consciousness.

source_sentence: 不貴重眼觸乃至意觸，不貴重眼觸為緣所生諸受乃至意觸為緣所生諸受，
translation: They are not valued by eye contact or even by mental contact, and they are not valued by sensations that arise from eye contact as a condition or by sensations that arise from mental contact as a condition.

source_sentence: 不貴重諸相，不貴重所依，不貴重助伴，不貴重布施波羅蜜多乃至般若波羅蜜多，
translation: They don't value characteristics, don't value what they rely on, don't value their companions, and don't value the perfection of generosity or even the perfection of wisdom.

source_sentence: 不貴重四靜慮、四無量、四無色定，不貴重四念住乃至八聖道支，不貴重八解脫、八勝處、九次第定、十遍處，
translation: They do not esteem the four meditations, the four immeasurable concentrations and the four formless concentrations. source_sentence: 不貴重空、無相、無願解脫門，不貴重四聖諦，不貴重十八空，不貴重真如乃至不思議界，
translation: They don’t esteem the liberation gate of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness; they don’t esteem the four noble truths; they don’t esteem the eighteen kinds of emptiness; they don’t esteem true reality or even the inconceivable realm.

source_sentence: 不貴重十地，不貴重五眼、六神通，不貴重佛十力乃至十八佛不共法，
translation: The ten stages are not valued, the five eyes and six supernatural powers are not valued, the ten powers of buddhas are not valued, up to the unique qualities of the eighteen buddhas.

source_sentence: 「復次，善現！
translation: “Furthermore, Sunetra!

source_sentence: 一切不退轉菩薩摩訶薩為欲饒益諸有情故，現處居家，方便善巧，雖現攝受五欲樂具，
translation: “All the nonregressing great enlightening beings, wishing to benefit sentient beings, are now at home, skillfully and skillfully taking care of the five requisites of sensual pleasure.

source_sentence: 而於其中不生染著，皆為濟給諸有情故，謂諸有情須食施食，須飲施飲，
translation: They do not give rise to defiled attachments because they want to help sentient beings. That is, when sentient beings need food and drink, they give it as food or drink.

source_sentence: 須衣施衣，須乘施乘，乃至一切所須之物皆給施之，令其意滿。
translation: They need clothing to give clothes, rides to give vehicles, and whatever they need, they give it to them so that their wishes will be fulfilled.

source_sentence: 善現！
translation: O Sunetra!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩自行布施波羅蜜多，亦勸他行布施波羅蜜多，恒正稱揚行布施波羅蜜多法，
translation: These bodhisattvas and mahāsattvas themselves practice the perfection of generosity on their own, encourage others to practice the perfection of generosity, and always correctly praise the practice of the perfection of generosity.

source_sentence: 歡喜讚歎行布施波羅蜜多者；
translation: They rejoice and praise those who practice the transcendent ways of giving.

source_sentence: 乃至自行般若波羅蜜多，亦勸他行般若波羅蜜多，恒正稱揚行般若波羅蜜多法，
translation: Even when they themselves practice the perfection of wisdom, they also encourage others to practice the perfection of wisdom, and they always correctly praise the practice of the perfection of wisdom.

source_sentence: 歡喜讚歎行般若波羅蜜多者。
translation: They rejoice and praise those who practice the perfection of wisdom.

source_sentence: 善現！
translation: O Sunetra!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩現處居家，以神通力或大願力攝受種種七寶資具滿贍部洲乃至三千大千世界，
translation: “Furthermore, the great enlightening beings who live at home now by means of spiritual power or great vows take in all kinds of provisions made of the seven jewels that fill Jambudvfpa and so on, up to as many worlds as there are atoms in a galaxy.

source_sentence: 持以供養佛、法、僧寶，及施貧乏諸有情類。
translation: It's maintained to make offerings to the treasures of the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṃgha, as well as to poor sentient beings.

source_sentence: 善現！
translation: O Sunetra!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩雖現處居家而常修梵行，終不受用諸妙欲境，雖現攝受種種珍財，
translation: “Although these great enlightening beings manifestly live at home, they always practice the holy life; yet they do not experience objects of subtle desire. Although they manifestly harbor various kinds of precious treasures,

source_sentence: 而於其中不起染著，又於攝受諸欲樂具及珍財時，終不逼迫諸有情類令生憂苦。
translation: They don't become defiled and attached to them, and when they take in the necessities and treasures of desire, they never oppress sentient beings so that sorrow and suffering will arise.

source_sentence: 善現！
translation: O Sunetra!

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩成就如是諸行、狀、相，知是不退轉菩薩摩訶薩。
translation: If a bodhisattva-mahāsattva accomplishes these kinds of practices, forms, and characteristics, he knows that he's an irreversible bodhisattva-mahāsattva.

source_sentence: 「復次，善現！
translation: “Furthermore, Sunetra!

source_sentence: 一切不退轉菩薩摩訶薩，有執金剛藥叉神常恒隨左右密為守護，常作是念：『此菩薩摩訶薩不久當證所求無上正等菩提，
translation: All the nonregressing bodhisattva mahāsattvas had a vajra-wielding yakṣa spirit who always guarded them closely with his left and right, always thinking, 'Soon this bodhisattva Mahāsattva will realize the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment that he seeks.

source_sentence: 願我恒隨密為守護，乃至無上正等菩提，常有五族執金剛神隨逐守護，
translation: May I always follow the esoteric as guardian, up to unsurpassed true and complete enlightenment, always with five clans holding the vajra spirit following and protecting me.

source_sentence: 時無暫捨，人非人等不能損害，諸天、魔、梵及餘世間亦無有能以法破壞所發無上正等覺心。』
translation: When there's no momentary abandonment, neither humans nor humans can harm it, and gods, Māra, Brahmā, and the rest of the world also don't have the mind of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment that arises from being destroyed by the Dharma.'

source_sentence: 由此因緣，乃至無上正等菩提，身心安隱常無擾亂。
translation: Because of these causes and conditions, up to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, body and mind are peaceful and always without disturbance.

source_sentence: 善現！
translation: O Sunetra!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩世間五根常無缺減，所謂眼、耳、鼻、舌、身根，出世五根亦無缺減，
translation: “These are the five mundane faculties of great enlightening beings: eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and so on.

source_sentence: 謂信、精進、念、定、慧根。
translation: It's the faculty of faith, effort, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom.

source_sentence: 善現！
translation: O Sunetra!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩身支圓滿相好莊嚴，心諸功德念念增進，乃至無上正等菩提。
translation: This is the body limbs of the bodhisattva Mahāsattva's body that are perfectly adorned with characteristics and features, and the merits of his mind increase moment by moment until he attains unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

source_sentence: 善現！
translation: O Sunetra!

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩成就如是諸行、狀、相，知是不退轉菩薩摩訶薩。
translation: If a bodhisattva-mahāsattva accomplishes these kinds of practices, forms, and characteristics, he knows that he's an irreversible bodhisattva-mahāsattva.

source_sentence: 「復次，善現！
translation: “Furthermore, Sunetra!

source_sentence: 一切不退轉菩薩摩訶薩，常作上士不作下士。」
translation: All the nonretrogressing bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas, always do what's superior and not what's inferior.

source_sentence: 具壽善現白言：「世尊！
translation: Guoshou Shancheng said, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩云何名為常作上士不作下士？」
translation: What is the name of this bodhisattva-mahāsattva who always acts as an upper person and doesn't act as a lower person?

source_sentence: 佛言：「善現！
translation: The Buddha said, Good manifestation!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩一切煩惱不復現前，剎那剎那功德增進，乃至無上正等菩提，
translation: “These great enlightening beings no longer manifest all afflictions, and moment by moment their virtue increases, until they attain unexcelled perfect enlightenment.

source_sentence: 於一切時心無散亂，是故我說常作上士不作下士。
translation: At all times, the mind isn't distracted; therefore, I say it always does what's superior and doesn't do what's inferior.

source_sentence: 「復次，善現！
translation: “Furthermore, Sunetra!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩成就無上菩提作意，常不遠離大菩提心，恒修淨命，不行呪術、醫藥、占卜諸邪命事，
translation: “These great enlightening beings accomplish the contemplation of unexcelled awakening. They are always not far from the determination for enlightenment, constantly cultivating pure livelihood; they do not practice magical spells, medicines, divinations, or other illusory means of livelihood.

source_sentence: 不為名利呪諸鬼神，令著男女問其吉凶，亦不呪禁男女、大小、傍生、鬼等現希有事，
translation: They won't cause fame or profit to spell ghosts and spirits, causing men and women to ask about good fortune and bad fortune, nor do they spell men and women, large and small, animals, ghosts, and so forth to show rare things.

source_sentence: 亦不占相壽量長短、財位、男女諸善惡事，亦不懸記寒熱、豐儉、吉凶、好惡惑亂有情，
translation: Nor does he divine the length of life span, wealth, and good and bad deeds of men and women. Nor does he predict cold and heat, abundance and scarceness, good and bad fortune or misfortune, neither good nor evil, to disturb sentient beings.

source_sentence: 亦不呪禁合和湯藥、左道療疾、結好貴人，亦不為他通致使命現親友相侚利求名，
translation: Nor does he incantate or prohibit the use of medicines for healing illnesses that are combined with hot water, left-hand paths for curing illnesses, or fetters for noble persons. Nor does he send messengers to show his friends, relatives, and kinsmen who seek fame by means of their supernatural powers.

source_sentence: 尚不染心觀視男女歡笑與語，況有餘事！
translation: They don't yet stain their minds and observe men and women laughing and speaking, so why wouldn't there be anything else?

source_sentence: 亦不恭敬供養鬼神，是故我說常作上士不作下士。
translation: Nor do they respect and offer support to ghosts and spirits; therefore, I say that they always become superior and not inferior.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 善現！
translation: O Sunetra!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩知一切法性相皆空，性相空中不見有相，不見相故遠離種種邪命呪術、醫藥、占相，
translation: “These great enlightening beings know that all the essential characteristics of dharmas are void, and their essential characteristics do not appear to exist in space. Because they do not see them, they are far removed from all kinds of wrong livelihood spells, medicines, and divination signs.

source_sentence: 唯求無上正等菩提，與諸有情常作饒益。
translation: They only seek unsurpassed perfect enlightenment and always work for the benefit of sentient beings.

source_sentence: 善現！
translation: O Sunetra!

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩成就如是諸行、狀、相，知是不退轉菩薩摩訶薩。
translation: If a bodhisattva-mahāsattva accomplishes these kinds of practices, forms, and characteristics, he knows that he's an irreversible bodhisattva-mahāsattva.

source_sentence: 「復次，善現！
translation: “Furthermore, Sunetra!

source_sentence: 一切不退轉菩薩摩訶薩於諸世間文章、伎藝，雖得善巧而不愛著。
translation: All the nonretrogressing bodhisattvas and mahāsattvas don't cling to worldly writings or arts, even though they attain skillfulness.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 善現！
translation: O Sunetra!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩達一切法性相皆空，性相空中世間所有文章、伎藝皆不可得，
translation: “This is the great enlightening being Universally Good’s realization that all things are void in their nature and characteristics, and that all writings and arts and crafts of the world cannot be found in the sky.

source_sentence: 又諸世間文章、伎藝，皆雜穢語邪命所攝，是故菩薩知而不為。
translation: Also, all worldly writings and arts are subsumed in the wrong livelihood of mixed words; therefore, the bodhisattva knows it and doesn't do it.

source_sentence: 善現！
translation: O Sunetra!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩於諸世俗外道書論，雖亦善知而不樂著。
translation: Although the bodhisattva Mahāsattva well knows and doesn't delight in non-Buddhist books and treatises, he doesn't cling to them.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 善現！
translation: O Sunetra!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩達一切法皆畢竟空，畢竟空中一切書論皆不可得，又諸世俗外道書論，
translation: Thus, the bodhisattva Mahāsattva realizes that all things are ultimately empty, and that all writings and treatises in space are ungraspable.

source_sentence: 所說理事多有增減，於菩薩道非為隨順，皆是戲論雜穢語攝，故諸菩薩知而不樂。
translation: The doctrine and principles taught often have increase and decrease, but the bodhisattva paths that are not compliant with them are all collected in conceptual elaborations and defiled speech, so bodhisattvas know they aren't happy.

source_sentence: 善現！
translation: O Sunetra!

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩成就如是諸行、狀、相，知是不退轉菩薩摩訶薩。
translation: If a bodhisattva-mahāsattva accomplishes these kinds of practices, forms, and characteristics, he knows that he's an irreversible bodhisattva-mahāsattva.

source_sentence: 「復次，善現！
translation: “Furthermore, Sunetra!

source_sentence: 一切不退轉菩薩摩訶薩復有所餘諸行、狀、相，知是不退轉菩薩摩訶薩。
translation: All nonretrogressing bodhisattvas and mahāsattvas also have other forms, shapes, and characteristics that they know are nonretrogressing bodhisattvas and mahāsattvas.

source_sentence: 吾當為汝分別解說，汝應諦聽，極善思惟！」
translation: I will explain it for you with discernment, so listen closely and think carefully!

source_sentence: 善現請言：「唯然！
translation: Sunetra then asked, Yes!

source_sentence: 願說！
translation: May it be explained!

source_sentence: 我等大眾專意樂聞。」
translation: We, the masses, concentrate our minds on listening.

source_sentence: 佛言：「善現！
translation: The Buddha said, Good manifestation!

source_sentence: 一切不退轉菩薩摩訶薩修行般若波羅蜜多，通達諸法皆無所有，常不遠離菩提作意，
translation: All the nonregressing bodhisattvas and mahāsattvas cultivating the perfection of wisdom comprehend that all things have no existence, always not far from the contemplation of enlightenment.

source_sentence: 不樂觀察論說諸蘊、諸處、諸界。
translation: They don't delight in observing the teachings that explain the aggregates, places, and elements.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩於蘊、處、界性相空理，已善思惟、善通達故。
translation: It's because the bodhisattva Mahāsattva has well contemplated and well comprehended the emptiness of the aggregates, places, and elements in their nature and characteristics.

source_sentence: 「善現！
translation: “O Sunetra!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩不樂觀察論說眾事。
translation: This is the bodhisattva Mahāsattva who doesn't delight in observing and discussing all things.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩於一切眾性相皆空，已善思惟、善通達故。
translation: This is because the bodhisattva Mahāsattva has well contemplated and well comprehended that all the natures and characteristics of all things are empty.

source_sentence: 「善現！
translation: “O Sunetra!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩不樂觀察論說王事。
translation: This is the bodhisattva Mahāsattva who doesn't delight in observing and discussing the king's affairs.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩住本性空，不見少法有勝有劣貴賤相故。
translation: This is because the bodhisattva Mahāsattva abides in the emptiness of his original nature and doesn't see that few things have superior or inferior, noble or base characteristics.

source_sentence: 「善現！
translation: “O Sunetra!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩不樂觀察論說賊事。
translation: This is a bodhisattva-mahāsattva who doesn't delight in observing and discussing the thief's business.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩住自相空，不見少法有得有失與奪相故。
translation: This is because the bodhisattva Mahāsattva abides in emptiness of its own characteristics and doesn't see that few things have gains, losses, and snatching characteristics.

source_sentence: 「善現！
translation: “O Sunetra!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩不樂觀察論說軍事。
translation: This is the bodhisattva Mahāsattva who doesn't delight in observing and discussing military doctrine.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩住本性空，不見諸法有多有少聚散相故。
translation: This is because the bodhisattva Mahāsattva abides in the emptiness of his original nature and doesn't see that there are many things with few scattered characteristics.

source_sentence: 「善現！
translation: “O Sunetra!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩不樂觀察論說戰事。
translation: This is the bodhisattva Mahāsattva who doesn't delight in observing and discussing battles.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩善住真如一切法空，不見少法有強有弱愛恚相故。
translation: This is because the bodhisattva Mahāsattva well abides in the true emptiness of all dharmas and doesn't see that few dharmas are strong or weak, and he loves the characteristic of anger.

source_sentence: 「善現！
translation: “O Sunetra!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩不樂觀察論說城邑事。
translation: This is a bodhisattva-mahāsattva who doesn't delight in observing and discussing the affairs of cities.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩住虛空界空，不見少法有攝不攝好惡相故。
translation: This is because the bodhisattva Mahāsattva abides in the space of the realm of space and doesn't see few things that are included or don't include good and bad characteristics.

source_sentence: 「善現！
translation: “O Sunetra!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩不樂觀察論說聚落事。
translation: This is the bodhisattva Mahāsattva who doesn't delight in observing and discussing the affairs of a village.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩住一切法空，不見少法有增有減合離相故。
translation: This is because the bodhisattva Mahāsattva abides in the emptiness of all dharmas and doesn't see that few dharmas have increases and decreases combined with distinctive characteristics.

source_sentence: 「善現！
translation: “O Sunetra!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩不樂觀察論說國土事。
translation: This is the bodhisattva Mahāsattva who doesn't delight in observing and discussing the affairs of his land.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩安住實際，不見諸法有屬不屬此彼相故。
translation: This is because the bodhisattva Mahāsattva abides in reality and doesn't see that all dharmas have afflictive or non-afflictive characteristics.

source_sentence: 「善現！
translation: “O Sunetra!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩不樂觀察論說我、有情乃至知者、見者事。
translation: This is a bodhisattva-mahāsattva who doesn't delight in observing and discussing self, sentient beings, or even those who know and see things.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩住畢竟空，都不見我乃至見者若有若無差別相故。
translation: This is because the bodhisattva Mahāsattva abides in ultimate emptiness and doesn't see self or even those who see it, whether they exist or don't have distinctive characteristics.

source_sentence: 「善現！
translation: “O Sunetra!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩不樂觀察論說相好事。
translation: This is the goodness of the bodhisattva Mahāsattva who doesn't delight in observing and discussing characteristics.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩善住無相，不見諸法有好有醜差別相故。
translation: This is because the bodhisattva Mahāsattva well abides in signlessness and doesn't see that all things have distinctive characteristics of goodness and badness.

source_sentence: 「善現！
translation: “O Sunetra!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩不樂觀察論說世間如是等事，但樂觀察論說般若波羅蜜多。
translation: This is the bodhisattva Mahāsattva who doesn't delight in observing and discussing worldly things like this, but rather delights in observing and discussing the prajñāpāramitā.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 甚深般若波羅蜜多遠離眾相，能證無上正等覺故。
translation: The profound prajñāpāramitā is free of all marks because it's able to realize unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

source_sentence: 「善現！
translation: “O Sunetra!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩常不遠離一切智智相應作意，修行布施波羅蜜多離慳貪事，
translation: “These great enlightening beings are always not far from the contemplation associated with omniscience and knowledge, cultivating transcendent generosity free of stinginess and greed.

source_sentence: 修行淨戒波羅蜜多離破戒事，修行安忍波羅蜜多離忿恚事，修行精進波羅蜜多離懈怠事，
translation: He cultivates the perfection of pure morality to avoid violations of precepts, the perfection of patience to avoid anger, and the perfection of effort to avoid laziness.

source_sentence: 修行靜慮波羅蜜多離散動事，修行般若波羅蜜多離惡慧事。
translation: He cultivates the perfection of meditation that's free of distracting things and cultivates the perfection of prajñāpāramitā that's free of bad wisdom.

source_sentence: 「善現！
translation: “O Sunetra!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩雖行一切法空，而愛樂正法不愛非法，恒願饒益一切有情。
translation: Although this bodhisattva Mahāsattva practices the emptiness of all dharmas, he loves the right teaching and doesn't love what's unlawful, always wishing to benefit all sentient beings.

source_sentence: 「善現！
translation: “O Sunetra!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩雖行不可得空，而常稱讚三寶功德，利益安樂一切有情。
translation: Although these bodhisattvas and mahāsattvas practice unobtainable emptiness, they always praise the merits of the Three Treasures for the benefit and welfare of all sentient beings.

source_sentence: 「善現！
translation: “O Sunetra!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩雖行諸法真如法界一味之相，而樂稱讚真如法界種種功德。
translation: Although the bodhisattva Mahāsattva practices the single- flavored characteristics of the true Dharma realm of all dharmas, he delights in praising the various merits of the true Dharma realm of reality.

source_sentence: 「善現！
translation: “O Sunetra!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩雖知諸法皆畢竟空，而愛善友不樂惡友。
translation: Although the bodhisattva Mahāsattva knows that all dharmas are ultimately empty, he loves good friends and doesn't delight in bad friends.

source_sentence: 言善友者謂佛、菩薩，若諸聲聞、獨覺乘等，能善教化安立有情，令趣無上正等菩提，
translation: Good friend means a buddha or bodhisattva. If śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and so on can skillfully edify sentient beings and lead them to unsurpassed true and complete enlightenment,

source_sentence: 亦名善友。
translation: They're also called good friends.

source_sentence: 「善現！
translation: “O Sunetra!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩常樂親覲一切如來、應、正等覺，若聞如來、應、正等覺在餘世界現說正法，
translation: These great enlightening beings always delight in seeing and associating with all buddhas. If they hear that the buddhas are to be seen in other worlds, they will show them the Teaching.

source_sentence: 即以願力往生彼界，供養恭敬、尊重讚歎聽受正法。
translation: With the power of their vow, they'll be reborn in that realm, offering support, respect, veneration, praise, and listening to the right teaching.

source_sentence: 「善現！
translation: “O Sunetra!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩若晝若夜常不遠離念佛作意，常不遠離聞法作意，由此因緣，
translation: “These are the causes and conditions by which a bodhisattva-mahāsattva, whether day or night, always remains free of thoughts of mindfulness of the Buddha and always keeps away from thoughts of hearing the Dharma.

source_sentence: 隨諸國土有佛世尊現說正法，即乘願力往彼受生，或乘神通往彼聽法。
translation: In each of the lands, there are buddhas and world-honored ones who presently teach the right teaching, so they'll be born there with the power of their vow or go there to hear the teaching by using their supernormal abilities.

source_sentence: 由是因緣，此諸菩薩生生之處常不離佛，恒聞正法無間無斷。
translation: Because of these causes and conditions, these bodhisattvas are always not separate from the Buddha wherever they are born, constantly hearing the right teaching without interruption or interruption.

source_sentence: 「善現！
translation: “O Sunetra!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩常為利樂諸有情故，雖能現起初靜慮定乃至非想非非想處定，
translation: It is because the bodhisattva Mahāsattva always benefits and pleases sentient beings, even though he can manifest the concentration of the first concentration up to the concentration of neither perception nor non-perception.

source_sentence: 而巧方便起欲界心，教諸有情十善業道，亦隨願力現生欲界有佛國土，
translation: He skillfully and expediently generates minds in the realm of desire, teaching sentient beings the ten good paths of action. Also by the power of his vow he manifests birth in the realm of desire where there are buddha-lands.

source_sentence: 供養恭敬、尊重讚歎諸佛世尊，聽聞正法修諸勝行。
translation: They pay homage to, respect, venerate, and praise the buddhas and world-honored ones, listening to the right teaching and cultivating superior practices.

source_sentence: 善現！
translation: O Sunetra!

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩成就如是諸行、狀、相，知是不退轉菩薩摩訶薩。
translation: If a bodhisattva-mahāsattva accomplishes these kinds of practices, forms, and characteristics, he knows that he's an irreversible bodhisattva-mahāsattva.

source_sentence: 「復次，善現！
translation: “Furthermore, Sunetra!

source_sentence: 一切不退轉菩薩摩訶薩常修布施乃至般若波羅蜜多，常行內空乃至無性自性空，
translation: All the nonretrogressing bodhisattva mahāsattvas always cultivate generosity and even the perfection of wisdom, always practicing internal emptiness or even the emptiness of the self-natureless self-nature of emptiness.

source_sentence: 常行真如乃至不思議界，常行苦、集、滅、道聖諦，常修四念住乃至八聖道支，
translation: He always practiced the true teachings up to the inconceivable realm, always practiced the noble truths of suffering, arising, cessation, and the path, always cultivating the four abodes of mindfulness up to the eightfold noble path.

source_sentence: 常修四靜慮、四無量、四無色定，常修八解脫、八勝處、九次第定、十遍處，
translation: He always cultivates the four meditations, the four immeasurable concentrations, and the four formless concentrations. He always cultivates the eight liberations, the eight spheres of mastery, the nine graduated concentrations, and the ten universal abodes.

source_sentence: 常修空、無相、無願解脫門，常修五眼、六神通，常修一切陀羅尼門、三摩地門，
translation: He always cultivated the liberation gate of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness. He always cultivated the five eyes and six supernatural powers. He always cultivated all the dhāraṇī teachings and samādhi-practices.

source_sentence: 常修佛十力乃至十八佛不共法，常修無忘失法、恒住捨性，常修一切智、道相智、一切相智，
translation: They always cultivate the ten powers of buddhas, up to the unique qualities of the eighteen buddhas. They always cultivate the state of nonforgetfulness and always abide in equanimity. They always cultivate omniscience, knowledge of the path, and knowledge of all characteristics.

source_sentence: 常修一切菩薩摩訶薩行，常求無上正等菩提。
translation: He always cultivates all the bodhisattva-mahāsattva practices and always seeks unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

source_sentence: 「善現！
translation: “O Sunetra!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩常於自地不起疑惑，不作是念：『我是不退轉，我非不退轉。』
translation: This is the bodhisattva Mahāsattva who always doesn't doubt his own ground and doesn't think, 'I am not turning back, and I am not turning back.'

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩不見少法可於無上正等菩提說有退轉，說無退轉。
translation: This is the bodhisattva Mahāsattva who doesn't see few things that can be said to have regressed from unsurpassed perfect enlightenment and says there's no turning back.

source_sentence: 「善現！
translation: “O Sunetra!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩於自地法無惑無疑。
translation: This is the bodhisattva Mahāsattva who has no confusion or doubt about the Dharma of his own ground.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩於自地法，已善了知、善通達故。
translation: It's because the bodhisattva Mahāsattva has well understood and well comprehended the teachings of his own ground.

source_sentence: 「善現！
translation: “O Sunetra!

source_sentence: 如預流者住預流果，於自果法無惑無疑，一來、不還、阿羅漢、獨覺及諸如來、應、正等覺各住自果，
translation: Just as the one who is ahead of the stream abides in the fruit of pre-flow, without perplexity or doubt regarding the factors of his own fruit. The once-returner, the one who does not return, the arhat, the pratyekabuddha and the tathagatas, the arhats and the true enlightened ones each abide in their own fruit.

source_sentence: 於自果法亦無惑無疑。
translation: Nor is there confusion or doubt about the self-fruit dharmas.

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩亦復如是，於自所住不退轉地所攝諸法，現知現見，無惑無疑。
translation: This bodhisattva Mahāsattva is likewise, knowing and seeing the dharmas that are included in the stage of nonretrogression where he lives, without confusion or doubt.

source_sentence: 「善現！
translation: “O Sunetra!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩住此地中，成熟有情、嚴淨佛土修諸功德，有魔事起即能覺知，
translation: “These great enlightening beings dwell in this land, developing sentient beings and purifying the buddha-lands by cultivating virtues.

source_sentence: 不隨魔事勢力而轉，善能摧伏種種魔事，令不障礙所修功德。
translation: He doesn't follow the power of demonic deeds, and he's able to skillfully subdue various demonic deeds so that they don't obstruct the merits cultivated.

source_sentence: 「善現！
translation: “O Sunetra!

source_sentence: 如有造作無間業者，彼無間心恒常隨逐，乃至命終亦不能捨。
translation: In the same way, when one creates an unremitting action, his unremitting mind always follows it; he cannot let go of it until the end of his life.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 善現！
translation: O Sunetra!

source_sentence: 彼能等起無間業纏增上勢力恒常隨轉，乃至命盡亦不能伏，設有餘心不能遮礙。
translation: They are able to equally produce the envelopers of unremitting action. The dominant power of these envelopers is perpetual and constant, but they cannot be subdued even when their life ends: because other minds do not obstruct them.

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩亦復如是，安住自地其心不動，無所分別，世間天、人、阿素洛等皆不能轉。
translation: This bodhisattva Mahāsattva is likewise, abiding in his own ground, his mind doesn't move, has no discrimination, and worldly gods, humans, asuras, and so forth can't change.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 善現！
translation: O Sunetra!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩其心堅固，超諸世間天、人、魔、梵、阿素洛等，已入菩薩正性離生住不退地，
translation: “These great enlightening beings, their minds firm and resolute, surpassing all the gods, humans, Māras, Brahmās, and asuras of the world, have entered the true nature of enlightening beings, which is free from birth and abiding in the stage of nonregression.

source_sentence: 已得菩薩殊勝神通，成熟有情、嚴淨佛土，從一佛國至一佛國，供養恭敬、尊重讚歎諸佛世尊及佛弟子，
translation: Having attained the supreme spiritual powers of enlightening beings, they mature sentient beings and adorn and purify buddha-lands. From one buddha-land to another, they offer support, reverence, veneration, and praise to world-honored Buddhas and their disciples.

source_sentence: 聽聞正法於諸佛所種諸善根，請問菩薩所學法義。
translation: He hears the right teaching, plants good roots in the buddhas, and asks about the meaning of the teachings studied by bodhisattvas.

source_sentence: 「善現！
translation: “O Sunetra!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩安住自地，修行般若波羅蜜多及餘善法，有魔事起即能覺知，
translation: “These great enlightening beings abide in their own stages, cultivating the perfection of wisdom and other good qualities. When demonic phenomena arise, they can immediately perceive them.

source_sentence: 終不隨順魔事，而轉方便善巧集諸魔事，置實際中方便除滅，於自地法無惑無疑。
translation: They never follow demonic deeds, but develop skillful means to skillfully gather demonic deeds and place them in the realm of reality to remove them with skillful means, without confusion or doubt about the dharmas of their own ground.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩知一切法皆入實際，通達實際非一非多，於實際中無所分別，
translation: “Thus the great enlightening beings know all things enter into reality, comprehending that reality is neither one thing nor many, and have no discrimination in reality.

source_sentence: 以於實際無惑無疑，於自地法亦無猶豫。
translation: Because there are no mental disturbances and no doubts in reality, they don't hesitate about the principles of their own ground.

source_sentence: 「善現！
translation: “O Sunetra!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩設轉受生，亦於實際無復退轉，終不發起趣向聲聞、獨覺地心。
translation: Suppose this bodhisattva Mahāsattva were to undergo birth, but he also had no further turning back in reality and never developed the mind that would lead to the stages of śrāvakas or pratyekbuddhas.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩達一切法自相皆空，於此空中不見有法若生若滅、若染若淨。
translation: This is the bodhisattva Mahāsattva who realizes that all dharmas are empty of their own characteristics and doesn't see anything in this sky that arises, ceases, or becomes defiled or pure.

source_sentence: 「善現！
translation: “O Sunetra!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩乃至轉身，亦不疑我當得無上正等菩提為不當得。
translation: This is the bodhisattva Mahāsattva who transforms his body and doesn't doubt that I will attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment or not.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩達一切法皆自相空，即是無上正等菩提。
translation: This is the bodhisattva Mahāsattva who understands that all things are empty of their own characteristics, which is unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

source_sentence: 「善現！
translation: “O Sunetra!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩安住自地不隨他緣，於自地法無能壞者。
translation: This is a bodhisattva-mahāsattva who abides in his own ground and doesn't follow the conditions of others, and there are no dharmas in his own ground that can be destroyed.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩成就無動無退轉智，一切惡緣不能傾動。
translation: This is the bodhisattva Mahāsattva's accomplishment of immovable and irreversible cognition, which doesn't budge for all bad reasons.

source_sentence: 「善現！
translation: “O Sunetra!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩，設有惡魔作佛形像來至其所，作如是言：『汝今應求阿羅漢果，
translation: “Then the great bodhisattva Mahāsattva came to them in the form of a buddha-figure created by Māra and said:

source_sentence: 永盡諸漏證般涅槃。
translation: He'll permanently end the contaminants and realize parinirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 汝未堪受大菩提記，亦未證得無生法忍，汝今未有不退轉地諸行、狀、相，
translation: You are unable to receive the assurance of great enlightenment, and you have not attained the tolerance of the nonarising of all things. Now you do not have the forms, characteristics, or signs of the stage of nonregression.

source_sentence: 如來不應授汝無上大菩提記，要有具足不退轉地諸行、狀、相，乃可蒙佛授與無上大菩提記。』
translation: The Tathāgata shouldn't give you the assurance of unsurpassed great enlightenment; it's only if you have the practices, forms, and characteristics of the stage of nonretrogression that you can be given the assurance of unsurpassed great enlightenment by the Buddha.'

source_sentence: 「善現！
translation: “O Sunetra!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩聞彼語已心無轉變，不驚不怖，不退不沒，是菩薩摩訶薩應自證知：『我於過去佛世尊所，
translation: “When these great enlightening beings hear those words, their minds don’t change, they aren’t frightened or terrified, and don’t retreat or sink.

source_sentence: 必已受得大菩提記。
translation: They'll surely have received the assurance of great enlightenment.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 菩薩成就如是勝法，定蒙如來、應、正等覺授菩提記。
translation: A bodhisattva who accomplishes such a superior teaching will surely receive the Tathāgata, Arhat, and Perfectly Enlightened One's assurance of enlightenment.

source_sentence: 我已成就如是勝法，云何如來、應、正等覺不授我記？
translation: I've accomplished such a superior teaching, so why wouldn't the Tathāgata, Arhat, or Perfectly Enlightened One give me an assurance?

source_sentence: 故我過去於諸佛所，定已受得大菩提記。』
translation: Therefore, I've certainly received the assurance of attaining great enlightenment in the past at the Buddha's place.'

source_sentence: 「善現！
translation: “O Sunetra!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩，設有惡魔或魔使者作佛形像，來授菩薩聲聞地記，或授菩薩獨覺地記，
translation: “This is great enlightening being Universally Good’s way of saying, ‘If there are any evil demons or messengers of demons who appear to be like buddhas and come to instruct the bodhisattvas on the path leading to enlightenment, they will give them assurance of enlightenment at the stage of disciples. Or they will give assurance of enlight

source_sentence: 謂菩薩言：『汝善男子何用無上正等菩提，生死輪迴久受大苦？
translation: It means a bodhisattva says, 'Why would you good sons use unsurpassed perfect enlightenment and experience great suffering for a long time in the cycle of birth-and-death?'

source_sentence: 宜自速證無餘涅槃，永離生死畢竟安樂！』
translation: It's advisable to quickly realize nirvāṇa without remainder for yourself, permanently parting with birth and death and ultimately at ease!'

source_sentence: 「善現！
translation: “O Sunetra!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩聞彼語已，作是念言：『此定惡魔或魔使者詐現佛像擾亂我心，
translation: Having heard these words, the great bodhisattva Mahāsattva had this thought:

source_sentence: 授我聲聞、獨覺地記，令退無上正等菩提。
translation: Teach me the assurance of the stages of śrāvaka and pratyekabuddhahood, causing me to regress from unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 定無諸佛教諸菩薩趣向聲聞或獨覺地，棄捨無上正等菩提。』
translation: There are certainly no Buddhist bodhisattvas or bodhisattvas who aspire to the stages of śrāvakas or pratyekbuddhas and abandon unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.'

source_sentence: 「善現！
translation: “O Sunetra!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩，設有惡魔或魔使者詐現佛像語菩薩言：『汝所受持大乘經典非佛所說，
translation: “Then the great enlightening being Universally Good said to the bodhisattva Sadāparibhūta, “If there are any evil demons or messengers of demons, they will deceive and show off their buddha-images.

source_sentence: 亦非如來弟子所說，是諸惡魔或諸外道為誑惑汝作如是說，汝今不應受持、讀誦。』
translation: Nor is it taught by the disciples of the Tathāgata, which are bad demons or non-Buddhists who deceive you and make such statements, so now you shouldn't memorize them or recite them.'

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩聞彼語已，作是念言：『此定惡魔或魔眷屬，令我厭捨所求無上正等菩提故，
translation: “Having heard these words, the great enlightening beings had this thought: This evil demon or its associates certainly cause me to become disillusioned with the supreme perfect enlightenment.

source_sentence: 說大乘甚深經典非佛所說，亦非如來弟子所說。
translation: He teaches the profound scriptures of the great vehicle that aren't taught by the Buddha, and they aren't taught by the Tathāgata's disciples.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 離此經典能得無上正等菩提，定無是處。』
translation: There's certainly no place for someone who can attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment apart from this sūtra.'

source_sentence: 「善現！
translation: “O Sunetra!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩當知已住不退轉地，過去諸佛久已授彼大菩提記。
translation: You should know that this bodhisattva Mahāsattva has already abided in the stage of nonretrogression, and it's been a long time since the past buddhas gave him the assurance of great enlightenment.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩具足成就不退轉地諸行、狀、相，若諸菩薩成就如是諸行、狀、相，
translation: “These are the practices, forms, and characteristics of enlightening beings who have perfected the stage of nonregression.

source_sentence: 當知已受大菩提記，必已安住不退轉地。
translation: You should know that someone who has received the assurance of great enlightenment will surely abide in the stage of nonretrogression.

source_sentence: 善現！
translation: O Sunetra!

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩成就如是諸行、狀、相，知是不退轉菩薩摩訶薩。
translation: If a bodhisattva-mahāsattva accomplishes these kinds of practices, forms, and characteristics, he knows that he's an irreversible bodhisattva-mahāsattva.

source_sentence: 「復次，善現！
translation: “Furthermore, Sunetra!

source_sentence: 一切不退轉菩薩摩訶薩行甚深般若波羅蜜多時，攝受正法，護持正法，
translation: When all the nonregressing bodhisattvas and mahāsattvas practice the profound perfection of wisdom, they embrace the right teaching and guard the right teaching.

source_sentence: 不惜身命，況餘親財！
translation: They don't spare their lives, so why wouldn't they spare the rest of their possessions?

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩常作是念：『我寧棄捨親友、珍財及自身命，終不棄捨諸佛正法。
translation: This is the kind of bodhisattva Mahāsattva who always thinks, 'I'd rather abandon my friends, treasures, possessions, and my own life than abandon the Buddha's right teaching.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 親友、珍財及自身命，生生恒有甚為易得，諸佛正法百千俱胝那庾多劫乃得一遇，
translation: Good friends, treasures, and your own lives are always easy to obtain. The buddhas’ true-dharma can be acquired for as many eons as there are hundreds of thousands of myriads of koṭis of kalpas.

source_sentence: 遇已長夜獲大利樂，故我定應精勤守護。』
translation: After encountering it for a long time, I'll attain great rewards and pleasures; therefore, I should certainly guard it with diligence.'

source_sentence: 善現！
translation: O Sunetra!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩護正法時應作是念：『我不為護一佛、二佛乃至百千諸佛正法，
translation: “When these great enlightening beings preserve the true teaching, they should think, ‘I do not protect one buddha, two buddhas, or even a hundred thousand buddha-teachings.

source_sentence: 普為護持十方三世諸佛正法，令不虧損。』」
translation: It's for the sake of universally protecting the right teachings of the buddhas of the ten directions and three times so that they don't fail.'

source_sentence: 時，具壽善現白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Guoshou Shancheng then said to the Buddha, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 何等名為諸佛正法？
translation: What's called the right teaching of the buddhas?

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩云何護持不惜身命？」
translation: How does this bodhisattva Mahāsattva guard and not spare his life?

source_sentence: 佛告善現：「一切如來、應、正等覺所覺所說一切法空，如是名為諸佛正法。
translation: The Buddha told Shancheng, All the teachings that all tathāgatas, arhats, and perfectly enlightened ones perceive as emptiness are thus called the right teachings of the buddhas.

source_sentence: 有愚癡類誹謗毀呰，言此非法、非毘奈耶，非天人師所說聖教，修行此法不得無上正等菩提，
translation: If there are ignorant people who denigrate and disparage this teaching, saying it's neither legal nor non-vinaya, not the noble teaching taught by gods or human teachers, cultivating this teaching will lead to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

translation: They won't realize nirvāṇa and ultimately attain peace.

translation: Protecting this teaching, the great enlightening beings do not cherish their own bodies or lives. They always think, ‘The emptiness of all things taught by buddhas is the refuge of sentient beings.

source_sentence: 菩薩修學速證無上正等菩提，拔諸有情生老病死，令得究竟安樂涅槃，
translation: Enlightening beings cultivate and quickly realize unexcelled true enlightenment, pulling out sentient beings from birth, old age, sickness, and death so that they may attain ultimately peaceful nirvana.

source_sentence: 故應護持不惜身命。』
translation: Therefore, you should guard and maintain it without sparing your life.'

source_sentence: 又作是念：『我亦墮在未來佛數，佛已授我大菩提記，由此因緣，諸佛正法即是我法，
translation: They also think, ‘I too will be counted among the future buddhas. The Buddha has already predicted my great awakening. Because of this causality, the true-dharma of all buddhas is precisely my dharma.

source_sentence: 我應護持不惜身命，我未來世得作佛時，亦為有情當說如是諸法空故。』
translation: I should protect and maintain it without sparing my life, so that when I become a buddha in the future, I'll also explain the emptiness of such dharmas for sentient beings.'

source_sentence: 善現！
translation: O Sunetra!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩見此義利，護持如來所說正法，不惜身命，乃至無上正等菩提，
translation: Seeing these benefits, the great enlightening beings preserve the teachings of the buddhas and do not give up their bodies or lives for the sake of enlightenment.

source_sentence: 常無懈癈。
translation: He always has no laziness.

source_sentence: 善現！
translation: O Sunetra!

translation: If a bodhisattva-mahāsattva accomplishes these kinds of practices, forms, and characteristics, he knows that he's an irreversible bodhisattva-mahāsattva.

source_sentence: 「復次，善現！

source_sentence: 一切不退轉菩薩摩訶薩聞諸如來、應、正等覺所說正法無惑無疑，聞已受持常不忘失，
translation: All the nonregressing great enlightening beings hear the true teaching taught by the Buddhas without confusion or perplexity, and they retain it after hearing it without forgetting it.

source_sentence: 乃至無上正等菩提。
translation: Up to unsurpassed correct perfect enlightenment.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

translation: It's because the bodhisattva Mahāsattva has well realized the dhāraṇī.

source_sentence: 爾時，善現白言：「世尊！
translation: It was then that the good manifestation said, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩已得何等陀羅尼故，聞諸如來、應、正等覺所說正法無惑無疑，
translation: “What sort of dhāraṇī did this great enlightening being who had attained these attainments hear the true teachings taught by the buddhas without confusion or perplexity and without doubt?

source_sentence: 聞已受持常不忘失？」
translation: After hearing it, they'll always retain it and never forget it?

source_sentence: 佛言：「善現！
translation: The Buddha said, Good manifestation!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩已得無盡藏陀羅尼、海印陀羅尼、蓮花眾藏陀羅尼等故，
translation: It's because the bodhisattva Mahāsattva has attained the inexhaustible store dhāraṇī, the ocean seal dhāraṇī, the lotus-treasury collection dhāraṇī, and so forth.

source_sentence: 聞諸如來、應、正等覺所說正法無惑無疑，聞已受持常不忘失？」
translation: He hears the right teaching taught by the Tathāgatas, Arhats, and Perfectly Enlightened Ones without confusion or doubt, and after hearing it, he retains it and never forgets it?

source_sentence: 具壽善現復白佛言：「是菩薩摩訶薩但聞如來、應、正等覺所說正法無惑無疑，
translation: Guoshou Shancheng then said to the Buddha: The great bodhisattva Mahāsattva merely heard the true Dharma taught by the Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One without confusion or perplexity.

source_sentence: 聞已受持常不忘失，為聞菩薩、獨覺、聲聞、天、龍、藥叉、阿素洛等所說正法，
translation: Having heard it, they retain it and never forget it. They hear the true teaching taught by bodhisattvas, pratyekabuddhas, śrāvakas, devas, nāgas, yakṣas, asuras, and so forth.

source_sentence: 亦能於彼無惑無疑，聞已受持常不忘失？」
translation: Can you also be without confusion or doubt about them and always retain what you've heard?

source_sentence: 佛言：「善現！
translation: The Buddha said, Good manifestation!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩普聞一切有情言音文字義趣，悉能解了無惑無疑，窮未來際常不忘失。
translation: This is the bodhisattva Mahāsattva who universally hears the words, sounds, words, and meanings of all sentient beings, fully understands them without confusion or doubt, and doesn't forget them forever.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩已得無盡藏陀羅尼等，任持所說令不忘故。
translation: It's because the bodhisattva Mahāsattva has attained the inexhaustible store of dhāraṇī and so forth, and he retains what he teaches without forgetting it.

source_sentence: 善現！
translation: O Sunetra!

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩成就如是諸行、狀、相，知是不退轉菩薩摩訶薩。」
translation: If a bodhisattva-mahāsattva accomplishes these kinds of practices, forms, and characteristics, he knows the nonretrogressing bodhisattva-mahāsattva.

translation: Thus, the nonretrogressing bodhisattva Mahāsattva has accomplished vast, immeasurable, countless, limitless, and inconceivable extraordinary merit.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 善現！
translation: O Sunetra!

source_sentence: 是菩薩摩訶薩已得殊勝無量無邊不共聲聞及獨覺智，是菩薩摩訶薩住此智中引發殊勝四無礙解。
translation: This is the bodhisattva Mahāsattva who has attained the extraordinary, immeasurable, limitless, and unique knowledge of śrāvakas and pratyekbuddhas, and this is the bodhisattva Mahāsattva who abides in this knowledge and gives rise to the extraordinary four unhindered understandings.

source_sentence: 由此殊勝四無礙解，世間天、人、阿素洛等無能問難，令此菩薩智慧辯才至窮盡者。」
translation: Because of these extraordinary four unhindered understandings, worldly gods, humans, asuras, and so forth can't ask questions that will cause this bodhisattva's wisdom and eloquence to reach their limit.

source_sentence: 爾時，善現復白佛言：「世尊！
translation: It was then that the good manifestation again said to the Buddha, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 能如殑伽沙劫宣說不退轉菩薩摩訶薩諸行、狀、相，由佛所說諸行、狀、相顯示不退轉菩薩摩訶薩成就無邊殊勝功德。
translation: They can explain the practices, forms, and characteristics of the nonretrogressing bodhisattva-mahāsattva for as many eons as there are grains of sand in the Ganges River, and because the practices, forms, and characteristics described by the Buddha show that the nonretrogressing bodhisattva-mahāsattva has accomplished limitless

source_sentence: 唯願如來、應、正等覺，復為菩薩摩訶薩眾說甚深義，令諸菩薩摩訶薩眾安住其中，
translation: “O great enlightening beings! May the Buddha, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, further explain the profound meaning of these teachings to the assembly of enlightening beings, so that all sentient beings may live therein.

source_sentence: 能修布施乃至般若波羅蜜多令速圓滿，能住內空乃至無性自性空令速圓滿，
translation: He's able to cultivate generosity and even the perfection of prajñāpāramitā so as to quickly perfect it, and he's able to abide in internal emptiness or even emptiness of the natureless self-nature so as to quickly perfect it.

source_sentence: 能住真如乃至不思議界令速圓滿，能住苦、集、滅、道聖諦令速圓滿，
translation: They can abide in the realm of reality and so on, up to the inconceivable realm, enabling it to be quickly fulfilled; they can abide in the noble truths of suffering, arising, cessation, and the path, enabling it to be quickly fulfilled.

source_sentence: 能修四念住乃至八聖道支令速圓滿，能修四靜慮、四無量、四無色定令速圓滿，
translation: They can cultivate the four abodes of mindfulness and so on, up to the eightfold noble path, quickly perfecting them; they can cultivate the four meditations, the four immeasurable concentrations, and the four formless concentrations, quickly perfecting them.

source_sentence: 能修八解脫、八勝處、九次第定、十遍處令速圓滿，能修空、無相、無願解脫門令速圓滿，
translation: They can cultivate the eight liberations, the eight spheres of mastery, the nine graduated concentrations, and the ten universal abodes so as to quickly bring about their fulfillment. They can cultivate the liberation through emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness so as to quickly bring about their fulfillment.

source_sentence: 能修陀羅尼門、三摩地門令速圓滿，能修極喜地乃至法雲地令速圓滿，
translation: They can cultivate the teachings of dhāraṇī and samādhi to bring about their swift completion, and they can cultivate the stage of ultimate bliss or even the stage of Dharma-cloud to bring about their swift completion.

source_sentence: 能修五眼、六神通令速圓滿，能修佛十力乃至十八佛不共法令速圓滿，
translation: They can cultivate the five eyes and six transcendent powers, causing them to be quickly perfected; they can cultivate the ten powers of buddhahood up to the speedy fulfillment of the unique qualities of enlightenment of the eighteen Buddhas.

source_sentence: 能修三十二大士相、八十隨好令速圓滿，能修無忘失法、恒住捨性令速圓滿，
translation: They can cultivate the thirty-two marks of greatness and the eighty secondary signs of greatness so as to quickly perfect them. They can cultivate the principle of nonforgetfulness and always abide in equanimity so as to quickly perfect them.

source_sentence: 能修一切智、道相智、一切相智令速圓滿。」
translation: They can cultivate omniscience, knowledge of the path, and knowledge of all characteristics so that they'll quickly be perfected.

source_sentence: 佛告善現：「善哉！
translation: The Buddha told Shancheng, Good!

source_sentence: 善哉！
translation: Excellent, good!

source_sentence: 汝今乃能為諸菩薩摩訶薩眾請問如來、應、正等覺甚深義處，令諸菩薩摩訶薩眾安住其中，
修住功德令速圓滿。
translation: He cultivates the merit of abiding so that it's quickly perfected.

source_sentence: 善現當知！
translation: Good manifestation, you should know!

source_sentence: 甚深義處，謂空、無相、無願、無作、無生、無滅、寂靜、涅槃、真如、法界、法性、實際，
translation: The sphere of profound meaning consists of emptiness, signlessness, wishlessness, noncontrivance, nonorigination, noncessation, tranquility, nirvana, reality, the cosmos, the nature of things, and reality.

source_sentence: 如是等名甚深義處。
translation: Such are the profound meaningful places of these names.

source_sentence: 善現當知！
translation: Good manifestation, you should know!

source_sentence: 如是所說甚深義處種種增語，皆顯涅槃為甚深義。」
translation: Thus, these profound meanings of what's taught are all expressed in various ways that reveal the profound meaning of nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 爾時，善現復白佛言：「為但涅槃名甚深義，為諸餘法亦名甚深？」
translation: It was then that the good manifestation again said to the Buddha, Does it mean that nirvāṇa alone is called profound and the other dharmas are also called profound?

source_sentence: 佛告善現：「餘一切法亦名甚深。
translation: The Buddha told Shancheng, All the other dharmas are also called profound.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 善現！
translation: O Sunetra!

source_sentence: 色亦名甚深，受、想、行、識亦名甚深，眼處乃至意處亦名甚深，色處乃至法處亦名甚深，
translation: Form is also called ‘ profundity.’ Feeling, conceptual identification, volition and consciousness are also called ‘ profundity.’ The sense base of the eye up to the sense base of the mind are also called ‘ profundity.’ The sense base of matter up to the factor base are also called ‘ profundity.’

source_sentence: 眼界乃至意界亦名甚深，色界乃至法界亦名甚深，眼識界乃至意識界亦名甚深，
translation: The element eye and even the element mind are also called ‘ profundity.’ The realm of form up to the realm of factors is also called ‘ profundity.’ The element consciousness of the eye up to the element consciousness of the mind are also called ‘ profundity.

source_sentence: 眼觸乃至意觸亦名甚深，眼觸為緣所生諸受乃至意觸為緣所生諸受亦名甚深，
translation: The sense contact of the eye and even the sense contact of the mind are also called profound.

source_sentence: 地界乃至識界亦名甚深，無明乃至老死亦名甚深，布施波羅蜜多乃至般若波羅蜜多亦名甚深，
translation: The earth realm and even the consciousness realm are also called profound, ignorance and even old age and death are also called profound, and the perfection of generosity and even the perfection of wisdom are also called profound.

source_sentence: 苦、集、滅、道聖諦亦名甚深，四念住乃至八聖道支亦名甚深，四靜慮、四無量、四無色定亦名甚深，
translation: The noble truths of suffering, arising, cessation, and the path are also called profound. The four abodes of mindfulness up to the eightfold noble path are also called profound. The four meditations, the four immeasurables, and the four formless concentrations are also called profound.

source_sentence: 八解脫、八勝處、九次第定、十遍處亦名甚深，空、無相、無願解脫門亦名甚深，
translation: The eight liberations, the eight spheres of mastery, the nine graduated concentrations and the ten universal abodes are also called profound. The liberation through emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness is also called profound.

source_sentence: 陀羅尼門、三摩地門亦名甚深，三乘菩薩所行十地亦名甚深，五眼、六神通亦名甚深，
translation: The approach of dhāraṇī and the approach of samādhi are also called profound, the ten stages practiced by the bodhisattvas of the three vehicles are also called profound, and the five eyes and six supernormal powers are also called profound.

source_sentence: 如來十力乃至十八佛不共法亦名甚深，三十二大士相、八十隨好亦名甚深，
translation: The Tathāgata’s ten powers up to the unique qualities of the eighteen Buddhas are also called ‘ profundity.’ The thirty-two marks and eighty secondary signs of a great personage are also called ‘ profundity.’

source_sentence: 無忘失法、恒住捨性亦名甚深，預流果乃至獨覺菩提亦名甚深，一切智、道相智、一切相智亦名甚深，
translation: The absence of forgetfulness and the nature of constantly abiding equanimity are also called profound. The fruit of stream-entry up to the enlightenment of the pratyekabuddhas is also called profound. Omniscience, knowledge of the path and knowledge of all characteristics are also called profound.

source_sentence: 一切菩薩摩訶薩行、諸佛無上正等菩提亦名甚深。」
translation: All the bodhisattva-mahāsattva practices and the buddhas' unsurpassed perfect enlightenment are also called profound.
